intro: Faramea paludicola, commonly known as the swamp faramea, is a species of flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in swampy or marshy areas. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are white or pale pink. Faramea paludicola plays a role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
